content: कपिल {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [कपि-लच्] {@--1@} Tawny, reddish; वाताय कपिला विद्युत् <ls>Mbh.</ls> {@--2@} Having tawny hair; <ls>Ms. 3. 8</ls>; (<ls>Kull.</ls> = कपिलकेशा). --लः {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of a great sage. [He reduced to ashes the 60,000 sons of Sagara who, while searching for the sacrificial horse of their father taken away by Indra, fell in with him and accused him of having stolen it; (see <ls>U. 1. 23</ls>). He is also said to have been the founder of the Sāṃkhya system of philosophy]. {@--2@} A dog. {@--3@} Benzoin. {@--4@} Incense. {@--5@} A form of fire. {@--6@} The tawny colour. {@--7@} Impure benzoin. {@--8@} <ab>N.</ab> of the sun. {@--9@} <ab>N.</ab> of a country. {@--10@} One of the incarnations of Viṣṇu. --ला {@--1@} A brown cow. {@--2@} A kind of perfume. {@--3@} A kind of timber. {@--4@} The common leech. {@--5@} <ab>N.</ab> of the female elephant of the south-east.
